content: You need to contact your email provider to get your password. Once you get it and enter at a Thunderbird prompt, Thunderbird will retain it for future logins.
creator: davidsk

content: Press Alt-e and choose Account Settings from the drop-down menu that appears. At the bottom of the left-hand column of the screen that opens is am "Account Actions" button. Click that then Add Mail Account.
creator: thepillenwerfer

content: Email accounts need to have server names for input and output, port numbers for each, connection and authentication for each, plus your email address and password. If your email account is with a popular email provider, such as Gmail or Outlook, Thunderbird will already have all the information needed, other than your email address and password. If your email address is not common, your email provider can provide the details mentioned here.
creator: davidsk

content: Please describe your situation in more detail. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: I suggest you contact bigpond again, as their error message indicates to contact them. Thunderbird cannot create a blacklist. That might be due to the IP address - again, a bigpond issue.
creator: davidsk

content: My suggestion is to stay the course. This is not being reported by others, and reverting to a prior release can cause more problems.
creator: davidsk

content: Now it works again. At the end the method to reset the symbol menues did the work. I can not say which caused the issue.
creator: holger.ruhfus

content:
First, if you have a suggestion for Thunderbird, please post it at https://connect.mozilla.org/ under IDEAS. Developers review suggestions there. This is a peer-to-peer help forum and we don't make those decisions.

Second, despite the narrow columns, you can still edit the password by using cursor to scroll left or right. And the 'copy password' copies the entire password, not just the characters displayed in the column.
creator: davidsk
